targets.name: 1 wk ahead
targets.description: One- to four-week ahead forecasts will be defined as the weighted ILINet percentage for the target week.

targets.name: 2 wk ahead
targets.description: One- to four-week ahead forecasts will be defined as the weighted ILINet percentage for the target week.

targets.name: 3 wk ahead
targets.description: One- to four-week ahead forecasts will be defined as the weighted ILINet percentage for the target week.

targets.name: 4 wk ahead
targets.description: One- to four-week ahead forecasts will be defined as the weighted ILINet percentage for the target week.

targets.name: Season onset
targets.description: The onset of the season is defined as the MMWR surveillance week (http://wwwn.cdc.gov/nndss/script/downloads.aspx) when the percentage of visits for influenza-like illness (ILI) reported through ILINet reaches or exceeds the baseline value for three consecutive weeks (updated 2016-2017 ILINet baseline values for the US and each HHS region will be available at http://www.cdc.gov/flu/weekly/overview.htm the week of October 10, 2016). Forecasted 'onset' week values should be for the first week of that three week period.

targets.name: Season peak percentage
targets.description: The intensity will be defined as the highest numeric value that the weighted ILINet percentage reaches during the 2016-2017 influenza season.

targets.name: Season peak week
targets.description: The peak week will be defined as the MMWR surveillance week that the weighted ILINet percentage is the highest for the 2016-2017 influenza season.
